content: What is the name of the 19th-century French author known for his novels about Parisian society, including 'Lost Illusions' and 'Eugénie Grandet'?

The author you're referring to is Honoré de Balzac. He was a French novelist and playwright who is primarily known for his sequence of almost 100 novels and plays collectively titled "La Comédie Humaine." This series offers a panorama of French society in the years after the Napoleonic Wars, particularly focusing on the ambitious and often ruthless rise of characters in Parisian society. 'Lost Illusions' ('Illusions perdues') and 'Eugénie Grandet' are both part of this extensive collection. Balzac's works are characterized by their detailed social realism and their deep psychological portraits of his characters. His influence on realism in literature is significant, and he is considered one of the founders of the realist tradition.
